metadata.name: Ilorin Wedding
metadata.description:
The Kakaki and its users are always present in the traditional llorin weddings. Ilorin, which happens to be the capital of Kwara State, Nigeria. The kakaki is used to entertain guests that are present in the llorin wedding, as the wife and her Bride's maids dance around the wedding venue, to the tune of the Kakaki.
The guests then honour the dancing wife, her bride's maids, and the Kakaki user by dancing along with them or spraying them with cash.
